subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Mandate of Heaven: When Kings Fall
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Mandate of Heaven: When Kings Fall.

hook.text: If a ruler is corrupt, heaven revokes his right to rule. Rebellion becomes not just justified â€” it's cosmic duty.

buildup.text: The Mandate of Heaven says rulers govern by divine permission. Good rule keeps it; bad rule loses it.

discovery.text: Natural disasters and famine were signs heaven was angry. Dynasties fell when people decided the mandate was lost.

twist.text: Unlike European divine right, this mandate could be revoked. Chinese political theory was more democratic than it seems.

climax.text: The Mandate of Heaven legitimized revolution for 3,000 years. Every Chinese dynasty rose and fell by this logic.

punchline.text: Bad rulers lose heaven's blessing. China made revolution a cosmic duty.

quiz.question: What is the Mandate of Heaven?
options: The belief that rulers govern by divine permission that can be revoked
